column5: I was offered a tag for next week by a member here. Great gesture from someone I have never met. It,s in my area.  Question is,can it be transfered to me do to health reasons,and how do we go about it,if it,s allowed at all.
Get it right from the horses mouth Brian.. call CO's Wayne Lintack or Rick Williams. If you need their direct cell #'s PM me !
Brian  I'm pretty sure transferring is only for group allocations like moose. As far as I know transferring of deer tags is not done.
I just finished my hunter safety course and we were instructed that the only tag that is transferrable is a moose tag that has been applied for by a group.  Deer tags are non-transferrable.  PB

Just so all know,Rick returned my call today,and the answer is like mentioned NO.  Always good to ask.  Thanks to the member that offered up his tag though.Very nice of you.  If you bow hunt,please pm me for a returned favor.
Hey, I just found out that it's okay..................as long as you don't get caught!
Yep.. just carry his entire wallet so "your" ID matches the name on the tag....
